title: The Universe of League of Legends: The one stop shop for lore, stories, bios, history, art and more!

embed.description: Welcome to Universe, the definitive source for the world of League of Legends.Here you'll find a vast collection of art and artifacts, like bios chronicling the origins of your favorite champions and landscapes depicting the historic regions they hail from.

body: Get your lore pants on boys and girls there's a lot to dig in to!

replies.body: In a flash...

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=a6QKoAqK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-16T21:16:10.136+0000)
>
> In a flash...

It is so awesome to know appearance of factions officially! It makes lore much more alive. Absolutely love it. Especially Shadow Isles and Demacia.

Demacia is more beautiful than I imagined.
We're glad that you like it. Please, please, please, don't forget to provide feedback as this is Beta and our intention is to 100% support this (content AND feature-wise) continuously.

I can tell you right now, first I love the design, but 2 tabs I would add are

1) stories: just a place to find all the written lore in one place, from stories like bloodline, to bios. would be great if you could see what's new at the top or something.

2) music: just a tab that puts your vast collection of music in one place (that isn't soundcloud)

And also I hope you guys feature this site prominently on your homepage and in the client, and not just for the first week its out! I'd bet most players who didn't read bloodline or burning tides the week those came out have no idea they even exist.
completely agree -- we definitely want to make it easier to filter/search/discover the types of media you want, in addition to sorting by champion/region (as it is now)

Overall I am really happy about this addition.
Some things that I noticed that are kinda odd are:

* The most important thing I've noticed is likely that you missed a lore piece:
The diary of the noxian who tried to capture rek'sai isn't on the page(not on rek'sais page and neither on the noxus,void or shurima pages)


* There is also another lore piece that is missing:
The color text that accompanied Ahris statue isn't there as well,though I guess this might be because the statue will be remade.


* I'm a bit confused about the order of the champions on the faction-pages.
Some ordered their champs from A-Z(Noxus,Shurima,Bandle,void,Bilgewater),some listed most of their champs in alphabetical order,but have a few who don't fit that order(Ionia,Piltover,Zaun,Demacia) and the others seem to be either not ordered at all.


* Aurelion lists Runeterra as his faction,but the Targon site,still counts him as one of its champions,which wouldn't be odd if he wasn't the only one that gets counted towards a faction,even if he lists another one


* Taric being counted towards demacia seems odd,I man I don't know what you have planned for him,but it looks like from this point on,his story will largely revolve around targon,not demacia,so shouldn't he be listed as a targon-champ,even if he comes from demacia?I mean Elise and Karthus are from Noxus(and Morde more or less too),but they are still listed as shadow isles champs
Incredibly!  It's like Greece and Italy combined!
It's Minas Tirith on a nation-wide scale.
You basically gave me this one Jaredan, handed on a silver twitter platter!
Who wrote the Ekko piece? Give them my regards, it was amazing.

May I ask why let's say Riven is marked Noxian (even though If I recall well she has stronger bounds to Ionia) just because she comes from there but Annie is not marked Noxian just because she wasn't growing up there, but still comes from there?

There are more champs whose placement confuses me. And Targon feels so empty despite the fact there are champs who are connected to or have vibe that would really fit Targon (Alistar, Aurelion Sol, Taric, Galio...).

And to not make it look like I'd be disappointed: Cool job. It's wonderful to see all it on one place, good layout design, great arts :)

Riven still beliefs in the noxian ideals and it doesn't say that she stayed in Ionia,so it makes sense to count her as a noxian.

And Annie was likely born after her parents left Noxus,meaning that she never was in Noxus.

This is bitter sweet for me.  Sweet because this is incredible.  Bitter because that list that I made of all the stories, the list that actually took me a *long* time to make and format correctly, is no longer relevant.

That, and Sharjo's stickied page of where to find the lore, were both super _super_ valuable to players in the long dark times before Universe went live - neither of you should feel like you didn't help people.  I appreciated what you did (and how much effort it was), even if you feel a little sad now.

Sharjo, if you're reading this, will you be cool with me unstickying your thread in the near future?  I'd always stated I'd sticky it as long as it was needed, and it was an absolute champ while it was.  I don't want to make your efforts (and Tattersall's efforts) feel unappreciated!

Go for it; it's served its purpose and now there's proper tools in place to show where the lore is, so now it can rest in the bowels of the Boards archives.

No hard feelings at all; I'm glad I could make something that was of any use at all!
Agreed 1000%.

From Tristana's piece. I guess Yordle food is just bursting with flavor
